description: Official GitHub MCP server providing comprehensive GitHub API access for repository management, file operations, and search functionality
author: GitHub
content: Access the GitHub API through Claude for comprehensive repository management, file operations, and search functionality.
features: Create, read, update, and delete files across repositories
Access repository information, branches, and metadata
Search code, issues, pull requests, and users
Automatic branch creation and Git history preservation
Batch operations support for multi-file changes

steps: Generate a GitHub Personal Access Token with repo permissions
Add the GitHub MCP server configuration with your token
Verify connection by asking Claude to show your repositories

installation.claudeCode: claude mcp add github --env GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=YOUR_TOKEN -- npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-github

useCases: Browse and manage repository files and folders
Access repository information and commit history
Create and update files with proper Git history
Find issues, pull requests, and collaborators
Analyze codebase structure and development patterns
security: Use Personal Access Tokens with minimal required scopes
Store tokens securely and rotate regularly
All operations maintain proper Git history
Built-in error handling for API issues

examples.title: Reading Repository Files
examples.description: Read files and directories from any GitHub repository you have access to. Claude will fetch the content and help you understand or modify it.

examples.title: Creating and Updating Files
examples.description: Create new files or update existing ones. The MCP server automatically creates branches and maintains proper Git history for all changes.

examples.title: Searching Code Across Repositories
examples.description: Search code using GitHub's powerful search API. Find functions, classes, patterns, or specific implementations across your repositories.

examples.title: Managing Issues and Pull Requests
examples.description: Query issues and pull requests using GitHub's search syntax. Filter by labels, status, author, and more.

examples.title: Repository Information and Statistics
examples.description: Access repository metadata, statistics, and insights. Useful for analyzing project health and contributor activity.
